item.title: Michael Cohen says he buried Stormy Daniels' 'catastrophic' allegation at Trump's direction
item.dc:creator: Dareh Gregorian and Adam Reiss and Gary Grumbach and Jillian Frankel and Lisa Rubin
item.description: Cohen, who was Trump's lawyer and self-described "fixer," is expected to face days of questioning over a payment that's at the center of the charges against his former boss.

media:content.media:text: Courtroom sketch of Michael Cohen testifies on the witness stand
media:content.media:description: Michael Cohen on the witness stand in Manhattan criminal court on May 13, 2024.

item.title: Troop movement suggests Israel could expand operations in Rafah soon, U.S. officials say
item.dc:creator: Monica Alba and Courtney Kube and Gabe Gutierrez and Phil Helsel and Raf Sanchez
item.description: The U.S. has seen recent troop movement that indicates Israel could expand operations in Rafah soon, but it has not made a formal assessment about whether a full-scale invasion is imminent, according to two U.S. officials.

media:content.media:text: israel hamas conflict smoke destruction explosion
media:content.media:description: Smoke billows during Israeli strikes in eastern Rafah in the southern Gaza Strip on May 13, 2024.

item.title: Baltimore bridge span removed; ship freed with precision blast
item.dc:creator: Dennis Romero and The Associated Press
item.description: Dali, the container ship that felled the Francis Scott Key Bridge in March, was freed Monday by precision explosive charges that dismantled the span of the Baltimore roadway that came down on it.

media:content.media:text: Image: smoke explosion charges explosive
media:content.media:description: Explosive charges are detonated to bring down sections of the collapsed Francis Scott Key Bridge resting on the container ship Dali on Monday, May 13, 2024, in Baltimore.

item.title: San Francisco could ban firefighters' uniforms over cancer risk
item.description: Lawmakers in San Francisco are scheduled to vote on whether to ban firefighters' clothing that contains 'forever chemicals' known to cause cancer. The city would be the first in the nation to impose such a ban, but alternatives are not widely available. Bigad Shaban of NBC Bay Area reports.

media:content.media:title: San Francisco could ban firefighters' uniforms over cancer risk
media:content.media:description: Lawmakers in San Francisco are scheduled to vote on whether to ban firefighters' clothing that contains 'forever chemicals' known to cause cancer. The city would be the first in the nation to impose such a ban, but alternatives are not widely available. Bigad Shaban of NBC Bay Area reports.

item.title: Orcas sink sailing yacht in Strait of Gibraltar
item.dc:creator: Reuters
item.description: An unknown number of orcas have sunk a sailing yacht after ramming it in Moroccan waters in the Strait of Gibraltar, Spain’s maritime rescue service said on Monday.

media:content.media:text: The Rock of Gibraltar is seen from a ferry in the Strait of Gibraltar
media:content.media:description: The Rock of Gibraltar viewed from a ferry in the Strait of Gibraltar, off southern Spain, in January 2023.

item.title: The man leading Russia's war in Ukraine is out in a surprise shake-up hinting at Putin’s true focus
item.dc:creator: Yuliya Talmazan and Keir Simmons and Natasha Lebedeva
item.description: This weekend's ouster Sergei Shoigu as Russia's defense minister follows a corruption scandal and a calamitous start to Russia’s invasion of Kraine.

media:content.media:text: Russian President Vladimir Putin has proposed removing Defense Minister Sergei Shoigu from his post. Putin nominated First Deputy Prime Minister Andrey Belousov for the role.
media:content.media:description: Russian President Vladimir Putin, left and his Defense Minister Sergei Shoigu during Victory Day celebrations in Moscow on May 9, 2024.

media:content.media:text: New Russian Defense Minister Andrey Belousov
media:content.media:description: Andrey Belousov, then the first deputy prime minister in Moscow on Thursday.

item.title: 'His body and my neck': Woman recalls punk singer's stage dive that sent her to hospital paralyzed
item.dc:creator: David K. Li
item.description: An Australian punk rock singer jumped into a western New York crowd and badly injured a fan he landed on, sending her to the hospital paralyzed, she and loved ones said Monday.

media:content.media:text: Bird Piché
media:content.media:description: Bird Piché

media:content.media:text: Bird Piché
media:content.media:description: Bird Piché running four days before the incident.

item.title: Patients with private insurance can face higher health costs at hospitals
item.dc:creator: Berkeley Lovelace Jr.
item.description: A report published Monday from the Rand Corporation found that in 2022, the prices hospitals charged to private insurance providers were 254% higher than what Medicare would have paid for the same services.

media:content.media:text: Patient sitting on hospital bed waiting
media:content.media:description: In 2022, hospital services accounted for 42% of health care spending for people with private health insurance.

item.title: Mississippi man whose mom and sisters were found dead on Mother's Day is killed in Arizona
item.dc:creator: Tim Stelloh
item.description: A Mississippi man wanted in connection with a triple shooting that left his mother and two sisters dead was fatally shot by state troopers in Arizona, authorities said Monday.

media:content.media:text: Mississippi man whose mom and sisters were found dead on Mother's Day is killed in Arizona gunfight
media:content.media:description: An exterior of the home where the murders occurred in Ridgeland, Miss.

item.title: Arizona Supreme Court pushes back enforcement date for 1864 abortion ban
item.dc:creator: Alex Tabet and Adam Edelman
item.description: The governor signed a bill repealing the Civil War-era law, but the new statute won't take effect for months, potentially allowing for enforcement of the old one.

media:content.media:text: arizona supreme court building exterior abortion ruling
media:content.media:description: Even though Democratic Gov. Katie Hobbs signed a repeal of the ban on May 2, that measure cannot take effect until 90 days after the state’s legislative session ends.

item.title: 'Judge Judy' Sheindlin sues for defamation over National Enquirer, InTouch Weekly stories
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press
item.description: “Judge Judy” Sheindlin sued the parent company of the National Enquirer and InTouch Weekly on Monday for a story that she said falsely claimed that she was trying to help the Menendez brothers get a retrial after they were convicted of murdering their parents.

media:content.media:text: judge judy tv personality
media:content.media:description: Judy Sheindlin in West Palm Beach, Fla., in 2020.

item.title: College commencements face pro-Palestinian disruptions
item.description: After pro-Palestinian protests and encampments this spring, a number of colleges faced disruptions of their graduation ceremonies. They included Duke University, where comedian Jerry Seinfeld gave the commencement address this weekend. Some colleges moved commencements to alternative venues to avoid disruptions. NBC News' Stephanie Gosk reports.

media:content.media:title: College commencements face pro-Palestinian disruptions
media:content.media:description: After pro-Palestinian protests and encampments this spring, a number of colleges faced disruptions of their graduation ceremonies. They included Duke University, where comedian Jerry Seinfeld gave the commencement address this weekend. Some colleges moved commencements to alternative venues to avoid disruptions. NBC News' Stephanie Gosk reports.

item.title: Parishioners stop armed teen from entering Louisiana church
item.description: A teen armed with a rifle was stopped by parishioners as he attempted to enter Mass at an Abbeville, La., church. KLAF's Jim Hummel reports.

media:content.media:title: Parishioners stop armed teen from entering Louisiana church
media:content.media:description: A teen armed with a rifle was stopped by parishioners as he attempted to enter Mass at an Abbeville, La., church. KLAF's Jim Hummel reports.

item.title: Lisa Bluder retires after Clark-led Iowa teams reach last 2 NCAA title games
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press
item.description: Lisa Bluder, who coached the Iowa women’s basketball team to the last two NCAA championship games, announced Monday that she is retiring after 24 years leading the Hawkeyes.

media:content.media:text: Image: female woman coach coaches sports
media:content.media:description: Iowa head coach Lisa Bluder, left, and associate head coach Jan Jensen in Iowa City, Iowa, on Jan. 27.

item.title: New Jersey Marine accused of threats to kill white people, commit mass shooting
item.dc:creator: Phil Helsel
item.description: An ex-U.S. Marine from New Jersey was arrested Friday and accused of threatening to kill white people and carry out a mass shooting, federal prosecutors said Monday.

media:content.media:text: United States Attorney's Office - District of New Jersey, in Newark, NJ.
media:content.media:description: The U.S. attorney's office in Newark, N.J.

item.title: 'Judge Judy' Sheindlin sues for defamation over National Enquirer, InTouch Weekly stories

item.description: “Judge Judy” Sheindlin sued the parent company of the National Enquirer and InTouch Weekly on Monday for a story that she said falsely claimed that she was trying to help the Menendez brothers get a retrial after they were convicted of murdering their parents.

item.title: Man who crashed U-Haul truck into barriers near White House pleads guilty
item.dc:creator: Zoë Richards
item.description: Sai Varshith Kandula of Missouri pleaded guilty in connection with what he said was a bid to overthrow the government last year.

media:content.media:text: Image: white house security barrier
media:content.media:description: A U.S. Park Police officer inspects a security barrier for damage in Lafayette Square near the White House in May 2023.

item.title: Body found in search of man who went into Colorado River on homemade raft
item.dc:creator: Phil Helsel
item.description: A body found in the Colorado River is believed to be that of Thomas Robison, who went into the waterway on a homemade raft with his dog last month, officials said.

media:content.media:text: missing person
media:content.media:description: Thomas Lee Robison of Santa Fe, N.M.

media:content.media:text: missing person
media:content.media:description: Thomas L. Robison with his Welsh corgi.

item.title: Plans unveiled for memorial honoring victims of racist mass shooting at Buffalo supermarket
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press
item.description: A permanent memorial will honor the victims of a racist mass shooting that left 10 people dead at a Tops supermarket in Buffalo, New York.

media:content.media:text: Police walk outside the Tops grocery store
media:content.media:description: An 18-year-old gunman killed 10 people at a Tops supermarket on May 14, 2022.

item.title: Do Facebook and Instagram influence your politics? 35,000 took a break to find out
item.dc:creator: David Ingram
item.description: Facebook and Instagram may not have quite the impact on people’s politics as some critics have feared.

media:content.media:text: The Facebook app logo is displayed on a smartphone.
media:content.media:description: Researchers wanted to understand how not using Facebook and Instagram would affect individual users' politics.

item.title: Kendrick Lamar nabs No. 1 spot on Billboard Hot 100 after Drake feud
item.dc:creator: Daysia Tolentino
item.description: While fans may dispute who won the recent rap battle between Kendrick Lamar and Drake, just one finished on top of the Billboard Hot 100 chart this week.

media:content.media:text: Kendrick Lamar performs onstage
media:content.media:description: Kendrick Lamar.
